task.title: Test the Circuit
task.shortdesc: Verify your wired circuit produces sound and responds to volume control before installing it in the guitar body.

step.cmd: Connect the circuit to an amplifier.

substep.cmd: Plug a 1/4 inch cable from the output jack to the amplifier input.
Turn on the amplifier and set the volume to maximum.

step.cmd: Test the pickup for sound output.

substep.cmd: Turn the volume potentiometer knob fully clockwise.
Tap a screwdriver on the pickup to test if sound is coming through.
Play music from your phone or music player and hold the speaker against the pickup.
substep.stepresult: You should hear the music playing through the amplifier.

substep.cmd: Continue playing music against the pickup.
Turn the volume potentiometer knob counterclockwise.
substep.stepresult: The sound should decrease as you turn the knob and become silent when fully counterclockwise.

step.cmd: If the circuit does not produce sound or the volume does not change, refer to the troubleshooting guide.

result.p: Your circuit is functioning correctly and ready for installation.
